newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Stop designer drugs, EU to tell would-be members.
newsitem.headline: Stop designer drugs, EU to tell would-be members.

text.p: East European countries queueing up for European Union membership will be told on Thursday they must crack down on the production of synthetic "designer" drugs like ecstasy.
The message will be delivered by EU justice and interior ministers when they meet their counterparts from east European and Baltic states bidding for membership, EU officials said.

Although trendy nightclub drugs like ecstasy and crack are also made within the EU itself, manufacture has increasingly been transferred to plants in the Baltic States, Poland and other eastern nations where laws are laxer.
The EU fears the struggling eastern countries will see the trade as a money spinner and a contribution to the economy rather than a crime to be stopped.
The ministers are expected to propose at the meeting ways of stamping out production of the drugs, including tracking the precursor chemicals used to make them.

Ireland -- which has made the fight against drugs a priority during its six-month presidency of the EU -- will urge the ministers to impose the toughest sentences possible on drug pushers in their own countries.
Ten eastern European countries have applied for EU membership -- Hungary, Poland, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Bulgaria, Romania, Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia and Slovenia.
